questions.text: From what distance can a 6/60 patient can see the 6/60 letter on Snellen chart:
True for visual pathway are all except?

options.label: A
options.text: Light rays are converged more by lens as compared to cornea

options.label: B
options.text: Light impulse is converted to nerve impulse

options.label: D
options.text: Time taken for impulse to reach the occipital cortex from retina is 124ms

questions.correct_answer: A. Light rays are converged more by lens as compared to cornea

questions.text: True for structure marked in the picture of left orbit?

options.label: B
options.text: Superior ophthalmic vein passes through it

options.label: C
options.text: Its located in lesser wing of sphenoid

options.label: D
options.text: Its present in apex of orbit

questions.correct_answer: B. Superior ophthalmic vein passes through it

questions.text: Which of the charts is based on log of minimal angle of resolution?
Which of the following lenses in indirect ophthalmoscopy will give maximum magnification
The most vital layer of cornea is developed from?

A patient presents with abnormal facies, frontal baldness and with weakness of the hands and difficulty in walking. Patient with slit lamp eye picture is given. He has muscle wasting and weakness. What is not seen?

options.label: B
options.text: Difficulty in releasing grip on shaking hands

questions.text: A young baby with hypotonia and development delay is referred to ophthalmology. The intra-ocular pressure is 29mmHg. The following slit lamp finding was observed. What abnormality would be most likely on urinalysis?
On the first post-op day after cataract surgery, the doctor noticed that the intraocular pressure is high and anterior chamber is shallow. Which of the following might not be the reason for it?
A 55 year old diabetic patient developed gradual painless loss of vision. He was diagnosed to have cataract. Which of the following type will he have?
This cataract surgery step is should not be done in which cataracts?
Preferred formula for IOL calculation in a patient who had previously undergone LASIK in young age?
65 years old diabetic female came to clinic with painless loss of vision over 3years. On ocular examination the following slit lamp picture was seen. Which is true?

options.label: B
options.text: Immature senile cataract, phacoemulsification with IOL

options.label: C
options.text: Sunflower cataract, ECCE with Aphakic glasses

questions.correct_answer: B. Immature senile cataract, phacoemulsification with IOL

questions.text: Post cataract surgery, the doctor saw some findings on slit lamp and wrote pupil block in his notes. What sign he might not have seen?
The distance in a normal individual is?
Which retinal fibres are papillomacular bundle fibres?

options.label: C
options.text: Break in inner blood retinal barrier

questions.correct_answer: C. Break in inner blood retinal barrier

questions.text: A 65 year old patient presents to clinic after seeing a round cobweb like opacity in front of one eye with occasional flashes of light. From this history, what is the approach of the doctor from among the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Screen the retina for any tears

options.label: B
options.text: Ask for any history of pain

questions.correct_answer: A. Screen the retina for any tears

questions.text: Identify the sign and retinal layer in which its seen
questions.correct_answer: B. Hard exudates- outer plexiform layer

questions.text: Find the odd one out

True for pneumatic retinopexy are all except?

options.label: C
options.text: Patient is advised not to travel by air for sometime

options.label: D
options.text: Not indicated if there is preexisting glaucoma

questions.correct_answer: B. Done for inferior retinal detachment

questions.text: All are seen in pathological myopia except?

A child presented with difficulty in vision. He had skeletal muscle weakness and mental retardation. On examination cherry red spot were seen. There was no hepatospleenomagaly present. Identify the disease.

A patient presents to you with inability to see on right side from both eyes. On slit lamp biomicroscopy – optic disc was normal and pupil reactions were normal. The doctor noted incongrous homonymous defects in his notes. Where is most likely lesion?

questions.correct_answer: B. Primary angle closure – laser iridotomy

A 3 yr old old was brought with white reflex in the right eye. Diagnosis of intraocular retinoblastoma was made on basis of clinical evaluation and MRI. The optic nerve was not involved. What would be the preferred chemotherapy regimen to be used?
Imaging is shown after a blunt trauma to an eye. Associated findings and signs are all except?

options.label: B

questions.text: A patient presents with tinnitus, deafness with the following sign. OCT is shown here. There were nodules present behind the retina. Likely diagnosis?

options.label: B
options.text: Is in contact with lipid layer of tear film

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: B. Is in contact with lipid layer of tear film

questions.text: A 28-year-old has progressive dementia, jaundice and akinetic rigidity in his upper limbs. On ophthalmic examination, a ring was seen in the periphery of cornea. Which layer is the deposit seen?
Which is INCORRECT statement for Ocular Herpes management?

options.label: A
options.text: Topical steroids are safe and effective in interstitial keratitis

options.label: B
options.text: Oral Acyclovir 400 BD given after resolution of ocular infection decreased rate of recurrence

options.label: C
options.text: Salmon patch is seen in disciform keratitis

options.label: D
options.text: Topical steroids are not given in epithelial keratitis

questions.correct_answer: C. Salmon patch is seen in disciform keratitis

questions.text: Identify
The following images are before and after use of phenylephrine drug. What could be the condition here?

A patient presents with blurring of vision associated with glares, light sensitivity in right eye. Slit lamp examination reveals thinning and ectasia of cornea and fine deep vertical stromal lines. The anterior chamber was deep. The patients refractive error is -4DS with -4DC at 90 degrees in that eye. What is false?

options.label: A
options.text: This is seen in young age

options.label: C
options.text: Bulging of eyelid is seen in upgaze

options.label: D
options.text: Oil droplet reflex can be seen on distant direct ophthalmoscopy

questions.correct_answer: C. Bulging of eyelid is seen in upgaze

questions.text: All of the statements are true for given condition except?

options.label: A
options.text: Elastotic degenerative changes in vascularized subepithelial stromal collagen

options.label: B
options.text: Induces corneal steepening in the axis of the pterygium

options.label: C
options.text: Linear epithelial iron deposition seen in the corneal epithelium

options.label: D
options.text: Conjunctival autografting with adjunctive treatment with mitomycin C reduces recurrence

questions.correct_answer: B. Induces corneal steepening in the axis of the pterygium

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: D. Lesion of right nucleus lead to right hypertropia

questions.text: Primary gaze picture is given. Which muscles are spared in this?

questions.text: On cover-uncover test the eye was seen to move towards outside in left eye when cover was removed from it. What is likely scenario?
If this patient is orthotropia, what will he see

options.label: A
options.text: Horizontal line from right eye and dot in center

options.label: B
options.text: Vertical line from right eye and dot in center

options.label: C
options.text: Horizontal line from left eye and dot in center

options.label: D
options.text: Vertical line from left eye and dot in center

questions.correct_answer: A. Horizontal line from right eye and dot in center
